comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: NRA-3A Skywarrior Bu No 130358 Gull gray and white scheme. Early thin cockpit framing, fairing for periscope beneath forward fuselage, rear radar and gun turret without weapons. Early wing with leading edge slats only on outer wing. Letters NADC and word JOHNSVILLE below cockpit. Some notes on YA3D-1P/NRA-3A Skywarrior 130358 Modified during build as prototype photo reconnaissance jet. Ninth Skywarrior to be built and accepted by US Navy in June 1954. From initial first batch of ten development airframes. Became NRA-3A from 1962 Used for Research and Development Test & Evaluation trials (RDT&E) at Naval Air Development Center, Johnsville, Pennsylvania. Salvaged in Dec. 1964. 1968 picture of NRA-3A Skywarrior 130358 at Johnsville. www.abpic.co.uk/photo/1051256/ Note matt overall blue gray scheme and modified nose painted black. Still with vestiges of rear turret. Whether it still exists or has been scrapped is as yet unknown.
